title: Ezekiel Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Ezekiel with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 48 chapters.

questions.question: In Ezekiel's vision of the four living creatures, which face is NOT mentioned as part of their appearance?
questions.explanation: The four faces described are of a man, a lion, an ox, and an eagle (Ezekiel 1:10). A serpent is not mentioned.

questions.question: What was the color of the wheels in Ezekiel's vision?
questions.explanation: The appearance of the wheels and their work was like unto the color of a beryl (a precious stone).

questions.question: Ezekiel was commanded to act as a sign to the house of Israel by doing what?
options: Preparing stuff for removing and digging through a wall
questions.correctAnswer: Preparing stuff for removing and digging through a wall
questions.explanation: Ezekiel was told to prepare stuff for moving and to dig through the wall as a sign of the captivity to come.

questions.question: Who was the rebellious house Ezekiel was prophesying against?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel prophesied to the rebellious house of Israel (often including Judah in the context).

questions.question: What was the symbolic meaning of Ezekiel covering his face while digging through the wall?
options: The prince not seeing the ground
questions.correctAnswer: The prince not seeing the ground
questions.explanation: Ezekiel was told to cover his face so he would not see the ground, symbolizing the prince's blindness.

questions.question: What was the fate of the prince among the people in Jerusalem according to Ezekiel's prophecy?
options: He would be taken captive to Babylon
He would be made king of Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: He would be taken captive to Babylon
questions.explanation: The prince would be taken in the snare and brought to Babylon, though he would not see it.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel, what will happen to the cities that are inhabited?
questions.explanation: The cities that are inhabited shall be laid waste and the land shall be desolate.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Ezekiel: 'Son of man, hath not the house of Israel, the rebellious house, said unto thee, What ________?'
questions.explanation: This is the exact phrase from the verse indicating the rebellious questioning.

questions.question: Ezekiel compares the noise of the wings of the living creatures to what?
questions.explanation: The noise of their wings was like the noise of great waters, the voice of the Almighty.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the names given to the two women representing Samaria and Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: The two women were named Aholah (Samaria) and Aholibah (Jerusalem); Abigail is not mentioned.

questions.question: What was the sin attributed to Aholah and Aholibah in Ezekiel 23?
questions.explanation: Both sisters committed whoredoms and defiled themselves with idols and foreign lovers.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel saw the likeness of the glory of the LORD as the appearance of a bow in the cloud on a rainy day.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel describes the brightness around the throne as the appearance of the bow in the cloud in the day of rain.

questions.question: True or False: The living creatures in Ezekiel's vision had six faces each.
questions.explanation: Each living creature had four faces: man, lion, ox, and eagle.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel's vision included wheels within wheels that could turn in any direction without turning their bodies.
questions.explanation: The wheels were described as a wheel in the middle of a wheel, turning wherever the spirit went without turning their sides.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel was told to eat bread with quaking and drink water with trembling as a sign to the people.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel was commanded to eat and drink with fear to symbolize the coming calamity.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel's prophecy states that there will always be vain visions and flattering divinations in Israel.
questions.explanation: God says there shall be no more vain vision or flattering divination in Israel.

questions.question: What did Ezekiel see above the firmament over the heads of the living creatures?
options: A throne with the likeness of a man upon it
questions.correctAnswer: A throne with the likeness of a man upon it
questions.explanation: Above the firmament was the likeness of a throne and on the throne the likeness of a man.

questions.question: Who were the 'princes' referred to in the prophecy of captivity in Ezekiel 12?
questions.explanation: The prince among the people in Jerusalem would bear the burden and be taken captive.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Thus saith the Lord GOD; There shall none of my words be ______ any more.'
questions.explanation: God declares His words will no longer be delayed but will surely come to pass.

questions.question: What was the primary theme of Ezekiel chapter 23 involving Aholah and Aholibah?
questions.explanation: Chapter 23 uses allegory to describe the unfaithfulness of Samaria and Jerusalem and their coming judgment.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the name 'Ezekiel' as used in the context of the book?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel means 'God strengthens' or 'God is my strength.'

questions.question: True or False: The spirit of the living creatures was also in the wheels in Ezekiel's vision.
questions.explanation: The spirit of the living creature was in the wheels, causing them to move together.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel, what will the people know when their cities are laid waste and land is desolate?
questions.explanation: The desolation is meant to make the people recognize God's sovereignty.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a characteristic of the living creatures Ezekiel saw?
options: Straight feet like a calf's foot
Had six eyes on each face
questions.correctAnswer: Had six eyes on each face
questions.explanation: The creatures had many eyes on their rings, not specifically six eyes on each face.

questions.question: How did Ezekiel describe the appearance of the fire around the throne he saw in his vision?
options: As the appearance of fire with brightness round about
questions.correctAnswer: As the appearance of fire with brightness round about
questions.explanation: He saw fire round about within it and brightness surrounding it.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Son of man, I have made thee a _______ and a watchman unto the house of Israel.'
questions.explanation: Ezekiel was appointed as a watchman to warn the house of Israel.

questions.question: True or False: The vision of the valley of dry bones is found in the book of Ezekiel.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 37 contains the vision of the valley of dry bones symbolizing Israel's restoration.

questions.question: In Ezekiel's vision, what do the four faces of the creatures represent?
options: Different aspects of God's creation and attributes
questions.correctAnswer: Different aspects of God's creation and attributes
questions.explanation: The faces (man, lion, ox, eagle) symbolize attributes such as humanity, strength, service, and swiftness.

questions.question: What did God say to Ezekiel about the proverb in the land of Israel: 'The days are prolonged, and every vision faileth'?
options: That it would be made to cease
That it was a sign of hope
questions.correctAnswer: That it would be made to cease
questions.explanation: God said He would make this proverb cease and that His words would not be delayed.

questions.question: True or False: In Ezekiel's vision, the four creatures' wings beat with the noise of a great army.
questions.explanation: The wings made noise like the noise of an army or great waters.

questions.question: What was Ezekiel's relation to the priestly line?
options: He was a Levite but not a priest
He was a priest, son of Buzi
He was a prophet only, no priestly lineage
He was from the tribe of Benjamin
questions.correctAnswer: He was a priest, son of Buzi
questions.explanation: Ezekiel is identified as a priest, son of Buzi.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 48, what is the name of the city that will be in the midst of the land?
questions.explanation: The city shall be called 'The LORD is there' (YHWH Shammah).

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel saw that the glory of the LORD departed from the temple before the destruction of Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel witnessed the glory of the LORD leaving the temple, symbolizing God's departure.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel use to describe the people of Israel's hearts, indicating stubbornness and rebellion?
questions.explanation: God says He will give them a new heart, a heart of flesh, replacing the heart of stone.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'new covenant' Ezekiel prophesies about?
options: A renewed law on tablets of stone
A covenant written on hearts with forgiveness
A return to the old sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: A covenant written on hearts with forgiveness
questions.explanation: God promises to put His law in their inward parts and forgive their iniquity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'I will sprinkle clean ______ upon you, and ye shall be clean.'
questions.explanation: God promises cleansing by sprinkling clean water on the people.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel's vision includes a detailed plan for a future temple.
questions.explanation: Chapters 40-48 contain detailed visions and plans for a future temple and land allotments.

questions.question: What was the purpose of Ezekiel eating the scroll in chapter 3?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel was told to eat the scroll to internalize the message of lamentation and woe.

questions.question: Who did Ezekiel see sitting on the throne in his vision?
options: A man with the appearance of fire and brightness
questions.correctAnswer: A man with the appearance of fire and brightness
questions.explanation: Ezekiel saw the likeness of a man surrounded by fire and brightness on the throne.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel was commanded to speak only when he saw visions.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel was commanded to speak God's words whether they listened or not.
